public class MovableImageView
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusPanel
implements Drawable

This class allows the viewing of an image and a rectangle drawn upon the image. This class has functions allowing the view to be scaled and translated arbitrarily.

Author:
Joshua Little

MovableImageView

public MovableImageView(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Image image,
                        gwt.g2d.client.math.Rectangle rect,
                        int width,
                        int height)
Creates an instance of MovableImageView

Parameters:
image - image to be drawn (can be null).
rect - rectangle to draw ontop of image.
width - width of canvas.
height - height of canvas.

setOffset

public void setOffset(double x,
                      double y)
Sets the new x- and y-offsets for the view. Positive values for x and y move the image and rectangle down and right, respectively.

Parameters:
x - the new x-offset.
y - the new y-offset.
See Also:
getXOffset(), getYOffset()

getXOffset

public double getXOffset()
Returns the current x-offset. Positive values correspond to the image moving to the right.

Returns:
the current x-offset.

getYOffset

public double getYOffset()
Returns the current y-offset. Positive values correspond to the image moving down.

Returns:
the current y-offset.

rect - the rectangle to draw.

setDefaultZoom

public void setDefaultZoom(double z)
Changes the default zoom to the specified value. This value is used when resetZoom() or reset() is called.

Parameters:
z - the new default zoom.
See Also:
#getDefaultZoom()

getDefaultZoom

public double getDefaultZoom(double z)
Returns the current default zoom. This value is used when resetZoom() or reset() is called.

Parameters:
z - the new default zoom.
See Also:
setDefaultZoom(double)

setZoom

public void setZoom(double t)
Sets the current zoom applied to the image and rectangle. The supplied value should be a value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive. This factor is then ran through an exponential scale and transformed into a value between the minimum zoom and maximum zoom. This scale is monotonically increasing.

Parameters:
t - the new zoom factor.
See Also:
getZoom(), setAbsoluteZoom(double), getZoomFactor()

setAbsoluteZoom

public void setAbsoluteZoom(double newZoom)
Sets the absolute zoom applied to the image and rectangle. The supplied value is not run through the exponential scale. As a result, calling getZoom() immediately after is guaranteed to return the value supplied to this function.

Parameters:
newZoom - the new absolute zoom to apply.
See Also:
setZoom(double), getZoom(), getZoomFactor()

getZoom

public double getZoom()
Returns the effective zoom applied to the image and rectangle.

Returns:
the effective zoom.
See Also:
setZoom(double), setAbsoluteZoom(double), getZoomFactor()

calcZoomFactor

private double calcZoomFactor(double z)
Returns a zoom-factor which will map to the supplied zoom when ran through the exponential scale.

Parameters:
z - the zoom to transform.
Returns:
the zoom-factor representing the supplied zoom.

calcZoom

private double calcZoom(double t)
Returns the zoom represented by the zoom-factor.

Parameters:
t - the zoom-factor.
Returns:
the absolute zoom the zoom-factor represents.

getZoomFactor

public double getZoomFactor()
Returns the zoom-factor that will map to the current zoom. If one calls setZoom(getZoomFactor()), the only change that might result would be due to rounding error.

Returns:
the zoom-factor mapping to the current zoom.
See Also:
setZoom(double), setAbsoluteZoom(double), getZoom()

getSurface

public gwt.g2d.client.graphics.Surface getSurface()
Returns the underlying canvas surface that this MovableImageView draws on. Drawing on this will result in an immediate change to the resultant view.

Returns:
the underlying canvas surface.

reset

public void reset()
Resets this MovableImageView to its default state. Calls both resetOffset() and resetZoom().

resetOffset

public void resetOffset()
Recenters the view on this MovableImageView's rectangle if it has one. If the rectangle is null, resets offset to zero.

See Also:
reset(), #resetScale()

resetZoom

public void resetZoom()
Resets the zoom to the default zoom.

See Also:
reset(), resetOffset()

draw

public boolean draw()
Draws this MovableImageView's image and rectangle onto the view. Will only draw if it has been invalidated, whether be changing its zoom or offset, or by calling invalidate().

Specified by:
draw in interface Drawable
Returns:
whether the Drawable ended up redrawing itself.
See Also:
redraw()

redraw

public void redraw()
Forces this MovableImageView to redraw itself.

Specified by:
redraw in interface Drawable
See Also:
draw()

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Invalidates this MovableImageView so that it will be forced to redraw itself on the next call to draw().

Specified by:
invalidate in interface Drawable
See Also:
redraw()

translate

public void translate(double dx,
                      double dy)
Changes this MovableImageView's offset by the supplied amounts. Positive values for dx and dy move the image and rectangle right and down, respectively.

Parameters:
dx - the amount to move right.
dy - the ammount to move down.
